net.openhft.chronicle.bytes

Interface ByteStringAppender<B extends ByteStringAppender<B>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Appendable, StreamingCommon<B>, StreamingDataOutput<B>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Bytes<Underlying>, BytesOut<Underlying>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBytes, ChunkedMappedBytes, CommonMappedBytes, EnbeddedBytes, GuardedNativeBytes, HexDumpBytes, MappedBytes, NativeBytes, NativeBytes.NativeSubBytes, OnHeapBytes, SingleMappedBytes, SubBytes, UncheckedBytes, UncheckedNativeBytes, VanillaBytes

    public interface ByteStringAppender<B extends ByteStringAppender<B>>
extends StreamingDataOutput<B>, Appendable
    Methods to append text to a Bytes. This extends the Appendable interface.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface net.openhft.chronicle.bytes.StreamingDataOutput

                          ArithmeticException
        Appends a double in decimal notation to a specific number of decimal places. Trailing zeros are not truncated.

        If the number would normally be printed with more decimal places, the number is rounded.

        Parameters:
        d - to append
        decimalPlaces - to always produce
        Returns:
        this

                     @NotNull BytesStore bs,
                     long start,
                     long end)
              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                     BufferOverflowException,
                     BufferUnderflowException,
                     IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                     IllegalStateException
        Appends a portion of a BytesStore to this in ISO-8859-1 format.
        Parameters:
        bs - the specified BytesStore that a portion of it will be appended to this
        start - the index of first byte (inclusive) of bs to append
        end - the number of bytes of bs to append
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an illegal argument is passed to the method
        BufferOverflowException - if the relative append operation exceeds the underlying buffer's capacity
        BufferUnderflowException - if the capacity of the BytesStore was exceeded
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the specified indexes for the BytesStore are out of range
        IllegalStateException - if the underlying Bytes is closed

      • appendDateMillis

        @NotNull
default B appendDateMillis(long dateInMillis)
                             throws BufferOverflowException,
                                    IllegalStateException
        Converts a specified long number to a date in the format yyyymmdd and appends the date to this. The specified long number represents a point in time that is time milliseconds after January 1, 1970 00:00:00 GMT.
        Parameters:
        dateInMillis - the specified long to convert to date and append to this
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        BufferOverflowException - if the relative append operation exceeds the underlying buffer's capacity
        IllegalStateException - if the underlying Bytes is closed

      • appendTimeMillis

        @NotNull
default B appendTimeMillis(long timeOfDayInMillis)
                             throws BufferOverflowException,
                                    IllegalStateException,
                                    IllegalArgumentException
        Converts a specified long number to time of day and appends it to this. The specified long number represents time in milliseconds after 00:00:00.000 GMT which will be converted to hours, minutes, seconds and milliseconds.

        Twelve bytes in the format of hh:mm:ss.ddd will be appended to this. hh, mm, ss and ddd represent hour, minute, second and millisecond.

        Parameters:
        timeOfDayInMillis - the long number that represents time of day in milliseconds
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        BufferOverflowException - if the relative append operation exceeds the underlying buffer's capacity
        IllegalStateException - if the underlying Bytes is closed
        IllegalArgumentException - if an illegal argument is passed to the method

      • append

        @NotNull
default B append(@NotNull
                          @NotNull BigDecimal bigDecimal)
        Appends a string representation of a specified BigDecimal to this.

        The string representation of the BigDecimal number is a standard canonical string form as described in BigDecimal.toString().

        Parameters:
        bigDecimal - the specified BigDecimal to append
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        BigDecimal

      • addressForRead

        long addressForRead(long offset)
             throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                    BufferUnderflowException,
                    IllegalStateException
        Obtain the underlying addressForRead. This is for expert users only.
        Parameters:
        offset - within this buffer. addressForRead(start()) is the actual addressForRead of the first byte.
        Returns:
        the underlying addressForRead of the buffer
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if the underlying buffer is on the heap
        BufferUnderflowException - if the offset is before the start() or the after the capacity()
        IllegalStateException
